definition[0]: to use something for a different purpose
example[0]: She was good at redirecting the children’s energy into something useful.
definition[1]: to send something in a different direction
example[1]: The flight was redirected to Cleveland.
definition[2]: to send someone’s letters to their new address from an address that they have left
definition[3]: to use money, effort etc for a different purpose
example[2]: We are redirecting funds to other departments.
example[3]: Management effort needs to be redirected into strategy and decision-making.
example[4]: All mail will be redirected to our new offices.
